application.name: overlapstats
application.brief: Calculates the statistics of overlapping cube regions

description.p: Taking a list of cubes and an image overlap list file from "findimageoverlaps", this application determines the statistics on all overlapping polygons of those provided images, and displays those values in a table as depicted below. Note that the units of Thichness is done in number of images, Area is done in square meters, and SN Count is also done in number of images.

description.p: In addition, if there are any cubes within the list that do not overlap with any other cube in the list, a second table is provided, which merely consists of those cube's filenames and Serial Numbers.

history.change: Fixed the formatting for a tab tabletype, improved documentation, and added an example.
The output file (TO) must now be specified.
Added support for image overlap files, which is what "OVERLAPLIST" needs to be. This is a required parameter obtained from running "findimageoverlaps."
Added error throwing when there are no overlaps among the cubes provided and other small bug fixes.

parameter.name: FROMLIST
parameter.description: The filename which contains a list of input cubes.

parameter.name: OVERLAPLIST
parameter.brief: This is the list of image overlaps corresponding to this control net
parameter.description: Use this parameter to select the filename which contains the overlap list. You can obtain this file by running "findimageoverlaps."

parameter.name: TO
parameter.description: The table file of the resultant stats. If any outlying cubes are found, they will be listed in a second table.

parameter.name: TABLETYPE
parameter.description: The resultant statistics of the overlapping cubes will be formatted in a table according to the following option.

option.description: Places the resulting statistics into an easy to read table, which displays values seperates by tabs.
Output the resulting statistics into Comma Seperated Value (CSV) format with values in scientific notation and a precision of 15.
